channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Why every CEO—and every American—should be fed up with Trump’s Fed attack
item.description: CEOs must recognize that they can inadvertently become complicit in the erosion of core American values as they watch, worried from the sidelines.

item.title: Where’s Your Evidence, Mr. President?
item.description: If the courts allow Trump to get away with firing Lisa Cook, the Fed will be stripped of its insulation from political pressure.

item.title: Court tosses Trump lawsuit against Maryland federal judges, saying allowing it to continue would ‘offend the rule of law’
item.description: U.S. District Judge Thomas Cullen, who was nominated by President Donald Trump, also criticized the administration's attacks on the judiciary.

item.title: Mortgage Fraud Claims Give Trump Weapon Against Lisa Cook and Others
item.description: The director of Federal Housing Finance Agency could win the president an opening on the Federal Reserve board.

item.title: Parents suing OpenAI and Sam AItman allege ChatGPT coached their 16-year-old into taking his own life
item.description: The wrongful death lawsuit said Adam Raine started using ChatGPT last year to help with challenging schoolwork.

item.title: Trump Media’s latest crypto venture borrows a page from the MicroStrategy playbook: hoard a specific cryptocurrency and dress it up as a business
item.description: Trump Media said it plans to purchase $105 million worth of the token created by Crypto.com that the new company will hold.

item.title: ‘Consumers are going to be shocked’: An expiring tariff exemption for goods under $800 is about to throttle the world of e-commerce
item.description: International packages ordered under the disappearing 'de minimis' exemption will incur charges that range from 10% to 50% of their declared value.

item.title: The Deadly Risks of Reporting In Gaza
item.description: Journalists endure the same harrowing reality as other Gazans: hunger and the constant threat of death. Those challenges risk further stifling what th...

item.title: How the N.Y.P.D.’s Facial Recognition Tool Landed the Wrong Man in Jail
item.description: Trevis Williams is eight inches taller than a man accused of flashing a woman in Union Square in February. The police arrested him anyway.

item.title: Nigel Farage Promises Mass Deportations if Elected UK Prime Minister
item.description: The plans announced by the leader of Reform U.K., which is leading opinion polls in Britain, illustrated how he is driving a hardening of the debate a...

item.title: Russia and Ukraine Target Energy Sites, Seeking Leverage Away From the Front
item.description: The two countries appear to be trying to raise political pressure on each other and send signals to Washington in case peace talks move forward.

item.title: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce Are Engaged, Singer Announces
item.description: The news was announced on Instagram: “Your English teacher and your gym teacher are getting married.”

item.title: European Officials Press Iran on Nuclear Talks. Here’s What to Know.
item.description: Representatives of three European powers met with ministers from Iran over its nuclear activities, but there was little sign of progress.

item.title: The Deadly Risks of Reporting In Gaza
item.description: Journalists endure the same harrowing reality as other Gazans: hunger and the constant threat of death. Those challenges risk further stifling what th...

item.title: Protesters in Israel Demand End of War in Gaza and Release of Hostages
item.description: Israelis took to the streets to urge the government to take action to free hostages held in Gaza, as the Israeli military pushed ahead with a widening...
